heisig_chinese_memo: After the soldier ends his profession in the army from his tours in Asia he likes to put the kettle on for a cup of tea and look at a replica of the King's crown that he served his whole career.

chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: After the soldier ends his profession in the army he likes to put the kettle on for a cup of tea and look at a replica of the King's crown that he served his whole career.
humanum_full_description_en:
The shape of a golden inscription like a jug. It was a container used to hold wine in ancient times. It was taken from a gourd. The original meaning is a water container. The upper part of the Jiajin inscription has a " big " shape, like the lid of a pot. The lid has a button, the body has two ears, the lower part is a large abdomen, and the bottom has ring feet. "poetry. Daya. "Han Yi": "Hundred Pots of Sake". "Zhou Li. Autumn official. "Puller": "The Forty Pot", Zheng Xuan's note: "The pot, the wine vessel."

"Shuowen": "The pot (壷), Kunwu Qiqi also. Pictogram. From the big, like its cover. All pots belong to the pot." Duan Yucai's note: "<Foubu> said: "Ancient "Kunwu is the stalwart." Kunwu was the first to do it. "The betrothal ceremony" said: "Bao, Jiu Zun also." Conversely said Hu Fang Jue has decorated ' "one said" Kun "is".. pot "alias, Wang Yun," Wen said, the Explanatory Notes ":" Kun who alias pot of Queensland also read as muddy and pot Double tones, I rhyme with the pot."

The oracle bone inscriptions are used as names, and the bronze inscriptions are used as the original meaning, which means a water container. Linghu pot: "Zhu (made) cast a pot." means a pot used for casting sacrifices. Jihou pot: "Jihouzha (made) cast pot."

Guodian Bamboo Slips "Yu Cong Si", Jian 26, " hu " from "缶" as the meaning sign, from " kua " as the sound sign. "Guodian. "Yu Cong Si" Jian 26: "Three pots and one 𦳚 (di)", which means that the three pots are placed together on the base of a few cases. "Huainanzi. "Thai Nationality": "There is 𦳚 in the Ou". "Huainanzi. "Annotation": "There are dikes in the bottle" (Zhang Chongli).

The ancient word "一" borrowed " jug " to express, see "一".

In addition, do not confuse the water vessel " pot " with the " wall " that represents the road in the palace in ancient times.
humanum_short_description_en: The shape of a golden inscription like a jug. It was a container used to hold wine and water in ancient times.
humanum_full_description:
甲金文象壺之形，乃古代盛酒水用之容器，取象於葫蘆，本義是盛水器。甲金文上部作「大」形，象壺的蓋子。蓋上有紐，器身有兩耳，下部為大腹，底有圈足。《詩．大雅．韓奕》：「清酒百壺」。《周禮．秋官．掌客》：「壺四十」，鄭玄注：「壺，酒器也。」

　　《說文》：「壺(壷)，昆吾圜器也。象形。从大，象其蓋也。凡壺之屬皆从壺。」段玉裁注：「〈缶部〉曰：『古者昆吾作匋。』壷者，昆吾始爲之。〈聘禮〉注曰：『壷，酒尊也。』《公羊傳》注曰：『壺，禮器。腹方口圓曰壷，反之曰方壷。有爵飾。』」一說「昆吾」是「壺」的別名，王筠《說文釋例》：「昆吾者，壺之別名也。昆讀如渾，與壺雙聲，吾與壺疊韻。」

　　甲骨文用作人名，金文皆用作本義，表示盛水器，令狐壺：「乍(作)鑄尊壺。」表示鑄造祭祀用的壺。己侯壺：「己侯乍(作)鑄壺」。

　　郭店竹簡〈語叢四〉簡26「壺」字從「缶」為意符，從「夸」為聲符。《郭店．語叢四》簡26：「三壺一𦳚(堤)」，表示三個壺一起放在几案一類的底座上。《淮南子．泰族》：「甂甌有𦳚」。《淮南子．詮言》：「瓶甌有堤」(張崇禮)。

　　古文字「壹」借用「壺」來表示，參見「壹」。

　　此外，勿將水器「壺」與表示古時宮中道路的「壼」相混。
humanum_short_description: 甲金文象壺之形，乃古代盛酒水用之容器，取象於葫蘆，本義是盛水器。

    • 士 [ shì ] scholar, gentleman; soldier
    • 亞 [ yà ] Asia; second
①陶瓷或金屬製成的一種有把有嘴的器具，通常用來盛茶、酒等液體：茶壺。酒壺。噴壺。油壺。
②像壺的形狀或出水狀態的東西：壺鈴(舉重輔助器械之一，形狀像水壺)。
③姓氏。

甲金文象壺之形，乃古代盛酒水用之容器，取象於葫蘆，本義是盛水器。甲金文上部作「 大 」形，象壺的蓋子。蓋上有紐，器身有兩耳，下部為大腹，底有圈足。《詩．大雅．韓奕》：「清酒百壺」。《周禮．秋官．掌客》：「壺四十」，鄭玄注：「壺，酒器也。」 《說文》：「壺(壷)，昆吾圜器也。象形。从大，象其蓋也。凡壺之屬皆从壺。」段玉裁注：「〈缶部〉曰：『古者昆吾作匋。』壷者，昆吾始爲之。〈聘禮〉注曰：『壷，酒尊也。』《公羊傳》注曰：『壺，禮器。腹方口圓曰壷，反之曰方壷。有爵飾。』」一說「昆吾」是「 壺 」的別名，王筠《說文釋例》：「昆吾者，壺之別名也。昆讀如渾，與壺雙聲，吾與壺疊韻。」 甲骨文用作人名，金文皆用作本義，表示盛水器，令狐壺：「乍(作)鑄尊壺。」表示鑄造祭祀用的壺。己侯壺：「己侯乍(作)鑄壺」。 郭店竹簡〈語叢四〉簡26「 壺 」字從「 缶 」為意符，從「 夸 」為聲符。《郭店．語叢四》簡26：「三壺一𦳚(堤)」，表示三個壺一起放在几案一類的底座上。《淮南子．泰族》：「甂甌有𦳚」。《淮南子．詮言》：「瓶甌有堤」(張崇禮)。 古文字「 壹 」借用「 壺 」來表示，參見「 壹 」。 此外，勿將水器「 壺 」與表示古時宮中道路的「 壼 」相混。

壺字的基本解释

壺
hú
见“壶”。

壺字的汉语字典释义

[①]［hú］
［《廣韻》户吴切，平模，匣。］
亦作“壷1”。“壶1”的繁体字。
(1)容器名。深腹，敛口，多为圆形，也有方形、椭圆等形制。新石器时代已有陶壶；商周时代的铜壶往往有盖；到汉代，方形的叫“钫”，圆形的叫“钟”。古代用以盛酒浆或粮食。后多为液体盛器，如茶壶、酒壶；也指某些固体物质的盛器，如冰壶、鼻烟壶。现代除陶瓷、金属制品外，尚有塑料、橡胶等制品。
(2)古代盛箭的鞘袋称箭壶。
(3)古代滴水计时的器具。
(4)古代宴饮时投壶的用具。
(5)古代一种瓦鼓，敲击以驱水虫。
(6)通“胡”。大。参见“壺蠭”。
(7)通“瓠”。葫芦。
(8)姓。汉有壶遂。见《汉书·司马迁传》。

壺字的康熙字典解释

【丑集中】【士字部】　壺； 康熙笔画：12； 页码：页243第15
同壷，與壼別。

壺字的源字形

字源演变：

甲骨文金文小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
壺字的起名意思

暂无。

pot
Basic explanation of words
pot
hú
See "pot".
pot
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［hú］
["Guangyun" Hu Wuqie, flat mold, box. ]
Also known as "壷1". Traditional characters for "hu 1".
(1) Container name. Deep belly, constricted mouth, mostly round, also square, oval and other shapes. There were clay pots in the Neolithic Age; bronze pots in the Shang and Zhou Dynasties often had lids; in the Han Dynasty, the square ones were called "Franium" and the round ones were called "bell." In ancient times, it was used to hold wine pulp or food. The latter are mostly liquid containers, such as teapots and hip flasks; they also refer to containers for certain solid substances, such as curling bottles and snuff bottles. In addition to ceramics and metal products, there are also plastic and rubber products in modern times.
(2) In ancient times, the sheath bag used to hold arrows was called the quiver.
(3) The ancient drip timing device.
(4) The utensils used to throw pots in ancient banquets.
(5) A kind of tile drum in ancient times, percussion to repel water worms.
(6) Through "Hu". Big. See "pot beetle".
(7) Through "hu". gourd.
(8) Last name. Han has a pot. See "Hanshu·Biography of Sima Qian".
pot
